title: Chart Signals Explained
text: Simple interpretations of VWAP and other key signals.

title: Chart Signals Explained
text:
VWAP: Volume-Weighted Average Price
The Volume-Weighted Average Price (VWAP) represents the average price at which a stock has traded throughout the day, weighted by volume. VWAP requires intraday data — such as tick-level or minute-level price and volume. It is calculated as:

\text{VWAP}_t = \frac{\sum_{i=1}^{t} P_i \cdot V_i}{\sum_{i=1}^{t} V_i}

Where:

P_i is the price at time i
V_i is the trading volume at time i
t is the current time point (e.g., minute or tick)

title: Chart Signals Explained
text:
Approximated VWAP (VWAPa) from Daily Data
While true VWAP (Volume-Weighted Average Price) requires intraday price and volume data, most freely available data sources only provide daily OHLCV data (Open, High, Low, Close, Volume). As a result, an approximated VWAP uses the typical price, which is the average of the daily high, low, and close:

\text{VWAP}_{\text{a}} = \frac{\text{High} + \text{Low} + \text{Close}}{3}

This is often referred to as the typical price. It does not factor in volume, and should be understood as a simple price-level proxy rather than a true volume-weighted measure.
This is not a true volume-weighted measure but it is commonly used as a proxy when minute-level data is unavailable. If you would like to see the true values, please donate so that I can afford premium access. With such access, I would create additional charts for you all.

Why VWAP Matters
VWAP helps investors and traders understand whether they are getting a good price relative to the day’s trading activity.

Buy below VWAP → favorable entry
Sell above VWAP → favorable exit



VWAP as a Trend Indicator
VWAP also acts as a dynamic indicator of market sentiment:

Price above VWAP → bullish signal

Price below VWAP → bearish signal

VWAP resets at the start of each trading day and reflects where the majority of trading volume occurred, making it a useful benchmark for intraday analysis.

title: About Nakametrics
text:
Nakametrics was created with a simple idea: that Bitcoin’s growing role in the financial system is one of the most important shifts in modern markets — and there’s still plenty of room to explore it through fresh charts, new ideas, and different perspectives.
This project focuses on visualizing companies that hold Bitcoin on their balance sheets, along with market behavior related to corporate Bitcoin exposure. The goal is to present these stories visually — in ways that stand apart from others in the space.
All charted data comes from publicly available sources and may occasionally be limited or delayed. Charts are updated regularly (ideally daily) to provide both short-term signals and long-term context.


Content includes:

Bitcoin holdings and balance sheet exposure among public companies
Market activity across bitcoin and related equities
Visual relationships between price, volume, and corporate treasury moves 
Bitcoin accumulation trends
Yield estimates and valuation models for Bitcoin holdings
Bitcoin balance sheet exposure among public companies 

The mission is to bring fresh insight and clarity to the Bitcoin-financial ecosystem through charts and visualizations.
About The Creator:
The site was created by, and is maintained by a visually-impaired bitcoin enthusiast (VIBE) whose interests include freedom money, Bitcoin, Bitcoin-related companies, data visualization, and data analysis. For some time, I have admired the exciting concepts others have created or build, after my a diagnosis with a progressive degenerative visual impairment in June 2024, I decided that delaying any concepts further may only result in them becoming more challenging in the future. The website and created charts are designed for a black background out of personal necessity due to my own visual impairment, which compromises my ability to see content with lots of white content. I apologize to those who have the opposite impairment.

NOTE: This site is unrelated to any company nor existing project and intends in no way to provide financial advice. Please consult documentation on official company websites and platforms for relevant financial information.

title: Nakametrics
text:
Simple charts showing how public companies hold and move with Bitcoin.

Welcome to Nakametrics — the platform for exploring the intersection of Bitcoin and capital markets.
The goal is to bring clarity to the chaos with clean visualizations and data-driven insights tracking Bitcoin holdings, market movements, and treasury strategies across public companies. Charts are based on public data and updated regularly as new sources and ideas become available.
If you’re curious about how Bitcoin intersects with the world of public companies, you’re in the right place.

title: Support My Work
text:
Why I’m Asking for Support
I work on this project independently, without institutional or financial backing.
What I create is based on free data sources. Much of what I would love to create relies on access to premium data sources. These tools help me make better content for you and the community.
I am very passionate about this work but the cost of maintaining access to high-quality financial data (like intraday price feeds, analytics APIs, and visualization tools) can be challenging to carry alone.


How You Can Help
If you have found my work helpful, insightful, or worth supporting, consider making a small donation.
Your support helps me:

Cover the cost of premium data sources

Expand coverage and analysis

Dedicate more time to building tools and research

Keep everything open, transparent, and accessible

How I will support you (if you would like):

I will give you a community shout out on X.com thanking you
I will add your handle to charts
I will add you to the donors section of this website
